subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Second-Mover Advantage in Social Media
description: A quick, practical guide to The Second-Mover Advantage in Social Media.

hook.text: Friendster launched in 2002. MySpace launched in 2003. Facebook launched in 2004. Guess who's worth $1 trillion.

buildup.text: Each social network learned from the one before it. Friendster crashed under load. MySpace became a cluttered mess.

discovery.text: Facebook studied both failures. Zuckerberg kept the design clean, the servers fast, and the network exclusive.

twist.text: Facebook launched only at Harvard, then Ivy League schools, then all collegesâ€”controlling growth Friendster never could.

climax.text: By 2009, Facebook passed MySpace. The third mover won by learning from two generations of costly mistakes.

punchline.text: Sometimes third time really is the charm.

quiz.question: How did Facebook succeed where Friendster and MySpace failed?
